row.entry: This module is an artistic feature to generate a frame around your image. The frame consists of a border with a user defined color and a frame line inside that border, which has another user defined color. There are various options for you to control the geometry of your frame.

sect5.title: Border size
sect5.para: This slider controls the size of the frame in percent of the underlying full image.

sect5.title: Aspect
sect5.para: With this combobox you can choose between different aspect ratios for the final output of this module, i.e. underlying image plus frame.

sect5.title: Orientation
sect5.para: If you select a non-square aspect ratio this combobox defines the orientation - portrait or landscape. Set to "auto" if you want darktable to select the most reasonable orientation based on the underlying image.

sect5.title: Horizontal position
sect5.para: Select from a set of pre-defined ratios where you want your underlying image be positioned on the horizontal axis. You can also right click and enter your own ratio as "x/y".

sect5.title: Vertical position
sect5.para: Select from a set of pre-defined ratios where you want your underlying image be positioned on the vertical axis. You can also right click and enter your own ratio as "x/y".

sect5.title: Frame line size
sect5.para: The percentage of the frame line size relative to the border size at its smallest part.

sect5.title: Frame line offset
sect5.para: Where the frame line is positioned relative to the underlying image. Select 0 for a frame line touching the image, 100% for a frame line touching the outer border limits.

sect5.title: Border color
sect5.para: Clicking on the colored field will open a color selector dialog which allows to define a color for the border in HSL or RGB color space. You can also activate a color picker by pressing and take a color probe from your image.

sect5.title: Frame line color
sect5.para: Clicking on the colored field will open a color selector dialog which allows to define a color for the frame in HSL or RGB color space. You can also activate a color picker by pressing and take a color probe from your image.
